individual_metadata.synopsis: If you saved Barcus from the windmill, you can meet him again in the underdark. He's been captured once again - this time by a band of duergar (who follow the Absolute, same as the goblins did previously). If you get rid of his captors, you can talk to him some more about his next steps. He's still keen on saving his friend, Wulbren.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Retro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Access debug book > Set quest flags & options > act 1 > Underdark > Duergar camp > Get unfortunate gnome4. goto 0.677; 41.554; 419.555. Talk to Barcus

28.speaker: Barcus Wroot
28.text: I'm tempted to cheer at the sight of these dead duergar, but there are still gnomes trapped behind those rocks.

23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
23.text: We need to get them out - now.

46.speaker: Barcus Wroot
46.text: Not now - we need to clear the cave-in!

45.speaker: Barcus Wroot
45.text: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...

91.speaker: Barcus Wroot
91.text: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.

102.speaker: Barcus Wroot
102.text: I know someone of your background would fit right in in that heart of horrors, but for others of us it's quite a frightening prospect.

81.speaker: Barcus Wroot
81.text: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
81.context: NodeContext: Resolute but actually pretty frightened.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: Moonrise? We're nearing the Towers. We're nearing answers.
69.context: NodeContext: Plainly stated, as if it's obvious. We're here to kill Nere, but Thrinn thinks we're here to save him. The player likely wants to keep it secret, but Lae'zel doesn't get subterfuge.

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: Moonrise? There's a lot resting on what we find in that place. It had better deliver.
88.context: NodeContext: Discreet reference to Nere, whose head we're to collect as a bounty.

77.speaker: Karlach
77.text: Barcus has the right idea. We've got to get to Moonrise too - and soon.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: The Towers must be close. And finding Moonrise means finding answers.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: First things first - you look exhausted. You should rest at my camp.

154.speaker: Barcus Wroot
154.text: Rest at a duergar camp? I'd be safer among mind flayers.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Wander off alone and you might just meet them.

126.speaker: Barcus Wroot
126.text: Fine. Show me where to go, and I'll try my luck. I'll have a better chance of rescuing Wulbren if I'm at my best.

17.speaker: Barcus Wroot
17.text: Now - I do realise an amount of thanks are in order. You've helped me. Twice.
17.context: NodeContext: Hesitating. He's been rude so far but does realize he owes you a debt.

37.speaker: Barcus Wroot
37.text: And so, you know - thank you. With that, I believe our business is concluded.

44.speaker: Barcus Wroot
44.text: Certainly not! In case you haven't been paying attention, my friend has been taken captive. He needs me.
44.context: NodeContext: Said with sarcasm. He loves wulbren.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I suspect I'll be rescuing you a third time, then.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: This is no place to travel alone.

143.speaker: Barcus Wroot
143.text: Pah. I was unlucky twice. The odds of it happening again are very slim.

156.speaker: Barcus Wroot
156.text: ... then again, a small rest might be prudent. Give me time to think.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I believe I'm destined for the Towers as well. I'll look for your friends.

159.speaker: Barcus Wroot
159.text: Friend. Singular. I'm looking for Wulbren - if anyone else should be incidentally helped, then bully for them.
159.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'FrienD'. Bitterness toward other guy

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'm sensing a bit of history here.

108.speaker: Barcus Wroot
108.text: It isn't personal. No one likes the Ironhand Gnomes except the Ironhand Gnomes.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Why don't you rest in my camp before your next big move?

14.speaker: Barcus Wroot
14.text: Before you go - I do realise an amount of thanks are in order. You've helped me. Twice.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

82.speaker: Barcus Wroot
82.text: Won't be needing it, thank you!

101.speaker: Barcus Wroot
101.text: Good bye, my misery's favourite companion.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Realistically, your friend is probably already dead.

65.speaker: Barcus Wroot
65.text: If Wulbren's dead, it's my job to find out who, when, where, and why.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Do you know what the Ironhand Gnomes were doing down here?

39.speaker: Narrator
39.context: NodeContext: Hi Milly! <3 Might be funny if it's slightly a little knowing sing-song

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?

151.speaker: Barcus Wroot
151.text: They're a clan of artificers in Baldur's Gate. I won't speak ill of their skills, but their politics are another matter entirely.

104.speaker: Barcus Wroot
104.text: They call themselves 'freedom fighters'. I call them extremists.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Ironhand Gnomes... I recognise the name. They fight for gnomish recognition in the city, right?

51.speaker: Barcus Wroot
51.text: Their fight has little to do with freedom and everything to do with power. I told Wulbren not to go near them, but did he listen? He did not.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: What do you think will happen if the Ironhand Gnomes get their hands on runepowder?

41.speaker: Barcus Wroot
41.text: Ahem... that is... what do you know about runepowder?

12.speaker: Barcus Wroot
12.text: Actually - don't answer that. The littler said about it, the better.

144.speaker: Barcus Wroot
144.text: No one should touch the stuff. Not Wulbren, and especially not those Ironhand jackals.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: I've learned that Wulbren and the others are in search of runepowder.
141.context: InternalNodeContext: MAde impossible per GUS-181625 - might bring htis back later if it feels like hter'es no chance to tell Barcus about it, but doesn't fit now

134.speaker: Barcus Wroot
134.text: I must speak with Wulbren. Now more urgently than ever.

53.speaker: Barcus Wroot
53.text: I don't have time for this - the Ironhand Gnomes might already have their hands on runepowder!

149.speaker: Barcus Wroot
149.text: You - get out of my nut! THIS MINUTE!

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: Moonrise? We're closing in on the Towers. And the curse...
68.context: NodeContext: Forced levity - a side-glance at the player referencing that we're actually here to kill Nere, not save him.

118.speaker: Gale
118.text: Moonrise. We're getting close to the lion's den - and plenty of questions I have for the lion, too.

155.speaker: Barcus Wroot
155.text: I don't know if you heard, but some of the Ironhand Gnomes - my friend Wulbren among them - have been taken prisoner in Moonrise Towers.

72.speaker: Barcus Wroot
72.text: As you know some of the Ironhand Gnomes - my friend Wulbren among them - have been taken prisoner in Moonrise Towers.

117.speaker: Barcus Wroot
117.text: They're not even going after him. I wish I were surprised.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I did. But not out of the kindness of my heart.

18.speaker: Barcus Wroot
18.text: I have no coin, but the foreman will be happy to provide.

103.context: InternalNodeContext: No cinematics, here for logic purposes only

116.speaker: Barcus Wroot
116.text: Please. They get very aggressive if we stop digging.

121.speaker: Barcus Wroot
121.text: Ah. It's you. The mascot of my ill fortunes.

137.speaker: Barcus Wroot
137.text: Once again, however, you've done me a decent turn. Most amusing, watching you wallop greylings.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: How did you end up here?

2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
2.text: Because there are gnomes trapped behind these rocks, stuck with a drow.

125.context: InternalNodeContext: No cinematics, here for logic purposes only

136.speaker: Barcus Wroot
136.text: Ah. It's you. The mascot of my ill fortunes...

0.speaker: Barcus Wroot
0.text: Much as I'd love to chat, I'm not allowed social breaks.
0.context: NodeContext: Sarcasm. He's being forced to dig-- social breaks is a great understatement

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Looks like you need rescuing. Again.

87.speaker: Barcus Wroot
87.text: I suppose I do. Though I'm not counting on one of you to help one of me.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Presumptuous. I'll get you out of here.

3.speaker: Barcus Wroot
3.text: These brutes are no mere goblins. I doubt you could take them on.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: That sounds like a challenge. I'll take care of your captors, and I'll get you out of here.

122.speaker: Barcus Wroot
122.text: You will? If you are successful, that would be most convenient.
122.context: NodeContext: A flash of excitement, then quick containment.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I could. But I probably won't.

1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
1.text: As I supposed. If you'll excuse me, I have something terribly important to attend to.
1.context: NodeContext: Sarcasm. He's attending to forced manual labor.

114.speaker: Barcus Wroot
114.text: I came down here looking for Wulbren - I suspected he and his little friends might've come to this region, and I was right.

73.speaker: Barcus Wroot
73.text: But! I was too late. Wulbren had already been taken to Moonrise Towers. The rest, put to work.
73.context: NodeContext: Gestures with head to his surrounding gnomes. Said with bitterness; he doesn't like these lads

4.speaker: Barcus Wroot
4.text: You won't find a worse gaggle of rare-do-wells than these 'Ironhand Gnomes' - except for Wulbren, desperate though his taste in companions might be.

93.speaker: Barcus Wroot
93.text: As I was contemplating his folly, I was spotted by a very ugly duergar.

119.speaker: Barcus Wroot
119.text: Now, I dig. It isn't good.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Sounds like you made a profound tactical error.

92.speaker: Barcus Wroot
92.text: I thought they'd be easy to outwit. I had an entire plan...
92.context: NodeContext: Poopoing them - 'they're not so tough'

67.speaker: Barcus Wroot
67.text: Unfortunately, it didn't account for an army of mad Underdark cultists.

96.speaker: Barcus Wroot
96.text: Nor did I account for some captives to be trapped in with the drow after the cave-in.

161.speaker: Barcus Wroot
161.text: Too many permutations. Quite the headache.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: What's the next part of your plan?

27.speaker: Barcus Wroot
27.text: Dig. And hope for an opportunity to escape.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: You could just ask for my help.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I'll keep you in my prayers.

132.speaker: Barcus Wroot
132.text: Thank you, but I doubt the gods will hear you down here.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: 'Hope', is it? Enjoy the rest of your life as a captive, then.

153.speaker: Barcus Wroot
153.text: How kind. Don't suffocate on your way out, hmm?

142.speaker: Player
142.text: The duergar are dead. You need to run.

31.speaker: Barcus Wroot
31.text: There are still gnomes trapped behind those rocks - with a vicious cultist, no less.

131.speaker: Barcus Wroot
131.text: I won't leave them to his whims.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Sounds like you need my help again.

135.speaker: Barcus Wroot
135.text: Help would be welcome. Whether you're up to the job remains to be seen.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I'll keep them in my prayers.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Your friends are lost - there's no point dying for them.

84.speaker: Barcus Wroot
84.text: How gallant. Don't suffocate on your way out, hmm?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: You were on a quest, weren't you? Making progress?
